1: <sup>1</sup> Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.
2: <sup>2</sup> And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.
3: <sup>3</sup> And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery; and when they had set her in the midst,
4: <sup>4</sup> They say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.
5: <sup>5</sup> Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?
6: <sup>6</sup> This they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground, as though he heard them not.
7: <sup>7</sup> So when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.
8: <sup>8</sup> And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.
9: <sup>9</sup> And they which heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest, even unto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
10: <sup>10</sup> When Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her, Woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man condemned thee?
11: <sup>11</sup> She said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said unto her, Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.
12: <sup>12</sup> Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying, I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.
13: <sup>13</sup> The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.
14: <sup>14</sup> Jesus answered and said unto them, Though I bear record of myself, yet my record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.
15: <sup>15</sup> Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.
16: <sup>16</sup> And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.
17: <sup>17</sup> It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.
18: <sup>18</sup> I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
19: <sup>19</sup> Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.
20: <sup>20</sup> These words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man laid hands on him; for his hour was not yet come.
21: <sup>21</sup> Then said Jesus again unto them, I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins: whither I go, ye cannot come.
22: <sup>22</sup> Then said the Jews, Will he kill himself? because he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come.
23: <sup>23</sup> And he said unto them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.
24: <sup>24</sup> I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if ye believe not that I am he, ye shall die in your sins.
25: <sup>25</sup> Then said they unto him, Who art thou? And Jesus saith unto them, Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning.
26: <sup>26</sup> I have many things to say and to judge of you: but he that sent me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him.
27: <sup>27</sup> They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.
28: <sup>28</sup> Then said Jesus unto them, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am he, and that I do nothing of myself; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.
29: <sup>29</sup> And he that sent me is with me: the Father hath not left me alone; for I do always those things that please him.
30: <sup>30</sup> As he spake these words, many believed on him.
31: <sup>31</sup> Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him, If ye continue in my word, then are ye my disciples indeed;
32: <sup>32</sup> And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
33: <sup>33</sup> They answered him, We be Abraham’s seed, and were never in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?
34: <sup>34</sup> Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.
35: <sup>35</sup> And the servant abideth not in the house for ever: but the Son abideth ever.
36: <sup>36</sup> If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.
37: <sup>37</sup> I know that ye are Abraham’s seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.
38: <sup>38</sup> I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.
39: <sup>39</sup> They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith unto them, If ye were Abraham’s children, ye would do the works of Abraham.
40: <sup>40</sup> But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard of God: this did not Abraham.
41: <sup>41</sup> Ye do the deeds of your father. Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God.
42: <sup>42</sup> Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.
43: <sup>43</sup> Why do ye not understand my speech? even because ye cannot hear my word.
44: <sup>44</sup> Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.
45: <sup>45</sup> And because I tell you the truth, ye believe me not.
46: <sup>46</sup> Which of you convinceth me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?
47: <sup>47</sup> He that is of God heareth God’s words: ye therefore hear them not, because ye are not of God.
48: <sup>48</sup> Then answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?
49: <sup>49</sup> Jesus answered, I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.
50: <sup>50</sup> And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.
51: <sup>51</sup> Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.
52: <sup>52</sup> Then said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my saying, he shall never taste of death.
53: <sup>53</sup> Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?
54: <sup>54</sup> Jesus answered, If I honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my Father that honoureth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God:
55: <sup>55</sup> Yet ye have not known him; but I know him: and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a liar like unto you: but I know him, and keep his saying.
56: <sup>56</sup> Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day: and he saw it, and was glad.
57: <sup>57</sup> Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?
58: <sup>58</sup> Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.
59: <sup>59</sup> Then took they up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
